function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Graphene oxide (GO) and reduced graphene oxide (rGO) contain oxygen functional groups (hydroxyl, carboxyl, carbonyl, and epoxy) that affect their physicochemical properties.","Impact":"Uncontrolled exposure to graphene derivatives may lead to unintended physiological effects due to their antiviral properties.","Mitigation":"Proper handling and disposal of graphene derivatives, implementation of safety protocols, and use of personal protective equipment.","Technologies":"Safety protocols, personal protective equipment, waste disposal methods.","People":"Laboratory workers, researchers, manufacturing personnel, waste management personnel.","Owner":"Laboratory supervisors, safety officers, researchers, waste management personnel."},{"Description":"Graphene derivatives with larger lateral size have stronger adsorption ability, which affects the physicochemical interaction with microorganisms.","Impact":"Uncontrolled use of larger-sized graphene derivatives may lead to unintended antiviral effects and interaction with microorganisms in the environment.","Mitigation":"Limiting the use of larger-sized graphene derivatives, conducting risk assessments, and implementing protective measures.","Technologies":"Particle size analysis, risk assessment tools, engineering controls.","People":"Researchers, manufacturing personnel, environmental health and safety officers.","Owner":"Laboratory supervisors, safety officers, researchers."},{"Description":"Increased number of graphene layers can weaken the antimicrobial activity and cause increased aggregation tendency.","Impact":"Improper use of graphene derivatives with increased number of layers may lead to reduced antimicrobial activity and potential aggregation of microorganisms.","Mitigation":"Implementing proper dispersion techniques, optimizing layer thickness, and monitoring for aggregation tendencies.","Technologies":"Dispersion optimization techniques, particle size analysis, monitoring systems.","People":"Researchers, manufacturing personnel, environmental health and safety officers.","Owner":"Laboratory supervisors, safety officers, researchers."}]}
